== Main Inclusion Report for dbus-1-qt3 ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/d/dbus-1-qt3]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Build dependency of knetworkmanager 0.7
 0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=dbus-1-qt3|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: none
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=dbus-1-qt3|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: none
** No binaries running as root, no daemons (of course it talks to the dbus daemon)
** Network activity: does not open any port  Does not handle incoming network data (but does send local data)
** Does process structured (PDF, etc) data
** This is a port of Qt 4 Dbus bindings to Qt 3, so source code review for Qt 4 may be relevant
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** In all situations the package works out of the box without configuration
** Asks no debconf questions
** Not packaged for Debian yet
** <nowiki>[[http://websvn.kde.org/branches/work/dbus-qt4-qt3backport/|Upstream]]</nowiki> is vigorous ?
** No known upstream bug tracker
** Hardware: Does not deal with hardware
** No test suite in the upstream source or packaging
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant
** <nowiki>[[http://www.netfort.gr.jp/~dancer/column/libpkg-guide/libpkg-guide.html|Debian library packaging guide]]</nowiki> standards compliant
** Packaging system cdbs,   Patch system is simple-patchsys,  no packaging oddities
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** qt3, dbus, all in main
 0. ''Background information:''
** The general purpose and context of the package is clear from the package's debian/control file.
** Upstream call it dbus-1-qt3 (was libdbus-1-qt3 for a bit, also dbus-qt4-qt3backport)
